entry.title: The Robins: Batman Meets Batwoman
entry.summary:
Author: SpiderFan_33

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,797Chapters: 22/22Kudos: 6

Summary: Years after the death of Bruce Wayne and with Dick Grayson suspended between life and death, Gotham gains a new Batman—and loses its illusions. Damian Wayne takes the cowl without apology: younger, sharper, and unwilling to pretend he is anything but himself. At his side is Tim Drake—partner, husband, and steady presence in a city unraveling under grief, fear, and rumor. Their bond is private, fierce, and unshakable, even as the weight of legacy presses in from all sides. As Alfred is laid to rest and Jason slips out of reach, new figures step into the void. Kate Kane arrives with hard-earned instincts and sharper suspicions. Lincoln March arrives with charm, shared history, and a pull Damian can’t quite ignore—one Kate doesn’t trust for a second. Gotham is watching its future take shape in real time: a Batman who loves deeply, fights decisively, and refuses to be gentle for the sake of comfort. This is a story about grief and devotion, temptation and loyalty, and the dangerous intimacy of letting someone truly see you while the city decides whether you deserve to stand.

entry.title: Face of the Sun
entry.summary:
Author: Yukhta

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,905Chapters: 7/7Kudos: 69

Summary: “And you control the sun. You must control it! Or not?! What about physics? And if you're a god, there must be books about you! And temples!” “There are books. And temples,” Damian tried with redoubled force to pull him off his jacket, but Tim clung to him with his other hand. “Lies! I haven't seen a single one dedicated to you! Certainly not in Gotham. And my parents are archaeologists, too!” “I have many names,” Damian replied dryly and finally shook Tim off. “The fact that you're an uneducated commoner says nothing about me. As for my temples,” the young man backed away. He didn't look like a god: ordinary jeans and a worn jacket with stretched pockets. Worn sneakers. Ordinary hair, black and tousled. Only his eyes stood out — such green eyes simply did not exist in nature, but there they were, right in front of Tim. “As for my temples, they are hidden. But those who want to find them always do.” or Wandering around Gotham, it is quite possible to encounter a deity stealing food from a store. If you happen to be in the right place at the right time.

Author: LittleLiability

Summary: Tim Drake despises Damian Wayne. entry.title: Permission
entry.summary:
Author: noctstate

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 933Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 74

Summary: It’s been a long night. Horrendously, stupidly, long. Not for any good reasons. If it were actually the job, actually saving people, putting away criminals all night, it would be reasonable, the buzzing beneath his skin. Understandable, even. He could brush it off as just adrenaline. Call it good. Instead it’s just that he and Damian ran together the entire patrol. It’s just that Tim’s wanted to grab onto him and push him against the nearest semi-reasonable, semi-flat surface and kiss that perpetually smug look off his face, for all eight hours of the patrol.
